newsitem.title: FINLAND: Nokia in wireless cooperation with rivals.
newsitem.headline: Nokia in wireless cooperation with rivals.

text.p: Finnish telecommunications group Nokia Oy said on Thursday it would cooperate with Motorola, Ericsson and Unwired Planet to create an open common protocol for wireless applications.
"The initiative is aimed at aligning the companies' efforts to bring advanced applications and Internet content to digital mobile phones," Nokia said in a statement.
By working together the companies would build common standards to encourage growth in the market for advanced mobile phones.

The single protocol -- or standard -- would work with any vendor's compatible handsets, and would be available to vendors and mobile operators around the world via the Internet as of September 15, it said.

It would provide mobile phone users with access to applications and functions such as handling of voice, fax and e-mail, information services and Internet access and an improved connection to existing and advanced telephony related services, Nokia said.
